sentences.english: "What are the chances of my recovering?" asked the bed-ridden man.
sentences.chinese: “我病愈的可能性有多大？”久病不起的病人问道。

sentences.english: It took Susan several weeks to recover her strength after the illness.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊病愈后数周才恢复体力。

sentences.english: He has writing to me frequently since I am ill.
sentences.chinese: 自我病愈以来，他屡次写信给我。

sentences.english: A good sleep may help you pick up flesh.
sentences.chinese: 好好睡觉可以救助你病愈后规复体重。

sentences.english: Help children feel integrative dysfunction recovery.
sentences.chinese: 有助于孩子的觉得统开平衡病愈。

sentences.english: She looked pale after the illness.
You'll recover in two or three days.
Mary has been getting about much more since she recovered from her illness.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽自从病愈以后，一直参加更多社交活动。

sentences.english: "What are the chances of my recovering?"asked the bed-ridden man.
sentences.chinese: “我病愈的可能性有多大？”久病不起的病人问道。

sentences.english: He has never come to see me since I was ill.
sentences.chinese: 自我病愈以来他还没来看过我。

sentences.english: Reinforces the body's ability to recover after sickness.
sentences.chinese: 加速身体病愈后的复元能力。

sentences.english: Captain Gaumard, recovered from his illness, had returned from Palma.
sentences.chinese: 茄马特船长病愈后从帕尔马岛回来了。

sentences.english: He recovered, he returned to work, and into the party.
sentences.chinese: 病愈后，他又回到了工作岗位，并且入了党。

definition: to recover completely (from illness or injury)
variant of 痊癒|痊愈[quan2 yu4]
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
to be critically ill/to be terminally ill
to be ill/to be in bad health
to prevent or treat a disease
to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital
to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
